Trust that by honoring your true self, you will naturally find your place and purpose.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c31 c36"><span class="c10">Not Assured, not belief in self , not self confidence, lacking self worth, not respect </span></p><h1 class="c9" id="h.cjv1ddtbks84"><span>Trust your Instincts &amp; Inner Knowing.</span></h1><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Building self-assurance starts with trusting your deep instincts and inner knowing. Often, we second-guess ourselves, doubting our ability to make the right decisions. But your inner knowing is there for a reason&mdash;it&#39;s a signaling method that&#39;s beyond your experiences, knowledge and superficial intuition. Trusting them helps you navigate challenges with confidence and clarity.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c36 c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c36 c43">:</span><span class="c8 c36">&nbsp;Next time you face a decision, pause and listen to your deep inner knowing. Trust that it&rsquo;s guiding you in the right direction. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Remember, the more you rely on your deep instincts and inner knowing the more assured you will become.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c31 c36"><span class="c10">Not Assured, not belief in self , not self confidence, lacking self worth, not respect </span></p><h1 class="c9" id="h.xh5k5aefqj3p"><span class="c12">Celebrate Small Wins: Use them to power you forward. </span></h1><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Self-assurance grows when we acknowledge and celebrate our small victories. These moments of success, no matter how minor they may seem, build confidence and reinforce your belief in your abilities. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">By recognizing your progress, you create a positive cycle of self-assurance that propels you forward.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c36 c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c36 c43">: </span><span class="c8 c36">Take time each day to reflect on your recent achievements, no matter how small. Then focus on what you have achieved today. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Celebrate these wins as proof of your capabilities, and let them fuel your confidence for the next challenge.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c31 c36"><span class="c10">Not Assured, not belief in self , not self confidence, lacking self worth, not respect </span></p><h1 class="c9" id="h.g2i5d6mk31io"><span>Embrace Your Authentic Self.</span></h1><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Being assured means being comfortable with who you are. When you embrace your authentic self, you stand firm in your values and beliefs. This creates a solid foundation for self-assurance. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Realize that being authentic attracts genuine respect and admiration, reinforcing your confidence in who you are.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c36 c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c36 c43">:</span><span class="c8 c36">&nbsp;Practice being true to yourself in every situation. Let go of the need for approval from others and focus on aligning with your values. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">Remember, the more authentic you are, the more naturally assured you will become.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c31 c36"><span class="c10">Not Assured, not belief in self , not self confidence, lacking self worth, not respect </span></p><h1 class="c9" id="h.x3n4ut66cs14"><span class="c12">Reframe your Challenges as Opportunities.</span></h1><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">One way to build self-assurance is by reframing challenges as opportunities for growth. Instead of viewing difficulties as threats, see them as chances to learn, adapt, and showcase your abilities. Give this a try. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">A positive mindset shift empowers you to face challenges with confidence, knowing that each one is an opportunity to strengthen your self-assurance.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c36 c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c36 c43">:</span><span class="c8 c36">&nbsp;The next time you encounter a challenge, consciously reframe it as an opportunity. Embrace the situation with curiosity and a willingness to grow. Then watch your self-assurance flourish.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c31 c36"><span class="c10">Not Assured, not belief in self, not self confidence, lacking self worth, not respect </span></p><h1 class="c9" id="h.fsl5zjgie1fn"><span>Speak Kindly &amp; Positively to Yourself</span></h1><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">The way you talk to yourself has a significant impact on your self-assurance. Negative self-talk can undermine your confidence, while positive affirmations can bolster it. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">By consciously choosing kind and encouraging words, you nurture a stronger, more assured mindset.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c36 c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c36 c43">:</span><span class="c36 c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8 c36">Start each day with positive affirmations that reinforce your strengths and abilities. When doubts arise, counter them with self-compassion and supportive language. </span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36"><span class="c8 c36">This practice of self compassion and positive self talk will gradually enhance your self-assurance.</span></p><p class="c60 c45 c36 c7"><span class="c8 c36"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c70 c17 c43 c84"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c70 c17 c84 c43"></span></p><h1 class="c54 c45 c61 c7" id="h.39bhgkws62it"><span class="c156 c17 c84 c43 c25"></span></h1><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c70 c17 c84 c43"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c70 c17 c43 c217"></span></p><p class="c151 c45 c61 title" id="h.ck0qhlz71v0w"><span class="c73 c10 c154 c25">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c115 c124">{M:DEFINE}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c27">Adaptive actions,</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c37 c25">Understand what &lsquo;Adaptive Actions&rsquo; are.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">&lsquo;Adaptive actions&rsquo; are all about adjusting to life&#39;s changes in a positive way. It&#39;s about switching up your routine when circumstances change. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">It&rsquo;s like adjusting your sleep for a new job or learning to collaborate in a team project. It&#39;s about growing from these experiences and creating positive outcomes along the way. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">By adapting, in a positive way not only do we navigate through life&#39;s curveballs, but we also improve ourselves. In doing so, we also make a positive impact on those around us.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c33 c72"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c72">{M:EARLY}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp; </span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c17 c27">Adapt</span><span class="c27">able</span><span class="c17 c27">&nbsp;actions</span><span class="c33 c17 c27">, </span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c33 c17 c27"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c37 c25">Understanding </span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&lsquo;Adaptive Actions&rsquo;</span><span class="c37 c25">.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">When we talk about &lsquo;adaptive actions&rsquo; we&#39;re really talking about the ways we adjust our behavior in a positive way. We change our actions to roll with the punches life throws at us. It&#39;s all about being flexible and resilient, learning from experiences, and adjusting our behavior in a positive way, based on new information or changing situations.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Let&#39;s say you&#39;ve always been a night owl, but you land a great new job that requires you to be early. Adaptive behavior here would be adjusting your sleep schedule to fit your new lifestyle, so you can be at your best at work.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Or maybe you&#39;ve been a solo worker all your life, but you&#39;ve now joined a project that requires a lot of teamwork. Adapting could mean learning to communicate more, sharing your work with others, and being open to feedback and collaboration.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span>Understand that a</span><span class="c8">daptive actions are all about embracing change, learning, and growing. It&#39;s about making the best out of any situation and continuing to move forward no matter what. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c33 c17 c30 c84"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c33 c17 c30 c84"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c73 c17 c25 c40"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c72">{M:EARLY}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c17 c27">Adapt</span><span class="c27">able</span><span class="c17 c27">&nbsp;actions</span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.92onb7ovhg4"><span class="c37 c17 c25">How &lsquo;Adaptable&rsquo; are you: </span><span>Consider</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;</span><span>these</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;</span><span>fields</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Here are examples of adaptable action in 3 different fields:</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Learning Technology: </span><span class="c8">Adapting to new software or apps keeps you current and capable.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Exercise Routine:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;After an injury, modify your workouts to avoid further harm and heal properly.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Communication Style:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Tailor your communication to be more effective with different people.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Each of these actions illustrates positive adaptability, helping you thrive in changing situations. How do you compare? </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your challenge: </span><span class="c8">Aim to incorporate adaptability into your daily life.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><h1 class="c26 c7" id="h.caaqdpk5xp1o"><span class="c73 c17 c25 c40"></span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c27">Not </span><span class="c17 c27">Adaptive acti</span><span class="c27">on, </span><span class="c10">rigid, resistant, blocked, quitting </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.iqwcthed3e3u"><span>Affirm your Ability to handle Change: Try an Affirmation. </span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Affirming your ability to handle change is a powerful way to boost your confidence and ease any anxiety about new situations. But how do you begin?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider this approach: </span><span class="c8">One way to start is with positive affirmations. Each morning, stand in front of a mirror, look yourself in the eyes, and say out loud, &quot;I can handle change. I am adaptable and resilient.&quot; Repeat it several times, letting the words sink in. You can also repeat this affirmation quietly to yourself during the day. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your challenge:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Make this affirmation routine a daily habit for a week or two. Pay attention to how your feelings about change evolve over time. This simple practice can be the first step in becoming more adaptable and confident in the face of life&rsquo;s challenges.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c33 c2"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10">Not adaptive action</span><span class="c10 c17">, rigid, resistant, blocked, quitting </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.wwyh3qix50wz"><span>Recognize that Change Fuels Personal Growth: Invite this.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Can you embrace the idea that change is a catalyst for personal growth? Can you invite this into your life? Truly accepting this can make you more open to new experiences and learning. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">But what if embracing change doesn&#39;t come naturally? How can you start shifting your mindset? Any other ideas? </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Try using a simple written affirmation: For example, write down the statement, &quot;Change is growth. With every change, I learn and evolve.&quot; Place this affirmation note somewhere you&rsquo;ll see it often, like your fridge or computer.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your challenge:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Each time you notice your affirmation note, take a moment to read it and reflect on its meaning. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">This simple daily reminder can help you gradually shift your perspective and welcome change as an opportunity for growth.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><h1 class="c26 c7" id="h.jh5oakkkk3ve"><span class="c73 c17 c25 c40"></span></h1><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c10 c17">&nbsp;</span><span class="c10">N</span><span class="c10 c17">ot Adaptive, resistant, blocked, quandary, </span><span class="c10">overwhelmed, </span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c12">Adapting through life: use the &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; model.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">In our complex world, it&#39;s easy to feel overwhelmed by the choices and challenges life presents. Whether it&#39;s a personal quandary, a professional crossroads, or just the daily grind, navigating through the intricacies of life requires adaptability. Enter the concept of &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; &ndash; a simple yet profound tool that can guide our decisions and actions.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span>&lsquo;</span><span class="c17 c40">Adaptive Action</span><span>&rsquo;</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;stems from &lsquo;systems thinking&rsquo;. It is primarily used to navigate complex situations and uncertainties in organizations. However, its principles are perfectly suited to our personal lives too. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">The &lsquo;Adaptive Action model</span><span>&rsquo;</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;is elegantly simple, just three steps termed: &quot;What? So what? and Now what?&quot;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c39 c17 c25">What?</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Start by observing and gathering data. What&#39;s happening in your current situation? Without judgments or interpretations, what are the patterns you see?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c39 c17 c25">So </span><span class="c43 c25">W</span><span class="c39 c17 c25">hat?</span><span class="c39 c17">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Reflect on these observations. What do these patterns mean for you? How do they affect your feelings, decisions, and actions?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c39 c17 c25">Now </span><span class="c43 c25">W</span><span class="c39 c17 c25">hat?</span><span class="c39 c17">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Given your reflections, what will you do next? What steps can you take to move forward?</span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.mt0qph1j7sug"><span class="c39 c120">Your challenge:</span><span class="c120 c40">&nbsp;Give this Adaptive Action model a try. </span></h1><h1 class="c26 c7" id="h.i6q9d5pccf66"><span class="c12"></span></h1><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10 c17">&nbsp;</span><span class="c10">N</span><span class="c10 c17">ot Adaptive action, confused, doubting, </span><span class="c10">quandary, </span><span class="c33 c10 c17">blocked,</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c37 c25">Consider this Case Study of</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;&lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; in daily life.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">To better understand how &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; might work in your daily life consider Jane&#39;s story:</span><span>&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Jane felt trapped in her job, uncertain about whether to switch careers, pursue further studies, or simply look for another role in her field. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Rather than remaining stuck or making a hasty decision, Jane embraced the 3 steps of Adaptive Action: &ldquo;What? So what &amp; Now what&rdquo;&hellip;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><ol class="c41 lst-kix_or1b1jg7c6oj-0 start" start="1"><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c8">Observing her daily tasks and feelings (What?) Jane realized she felt most drained on days dominated by repetitive tasks and minimal human interaction.</span></li></ol><p class="c1 c7 c24"><span class="c8"></span></p><ol class="c41 lst-kix_or1b1jg7c6oj-0" start="2"><li class="c1 c24 c79 li-bullet-0"><span class="c17 c40">Reflecting on this (So what?) </span><span>Jane</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;deduced that it wasn&#39;t her entire job she disliked, but specific components of it. </span></li></ol><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><ol class="c41 lst-kix_or1b1jg7c6oj-0" start="3"><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c8">Armed with this insight and after exploring options (Now what?) Jane began networking and even considered classes in fields she felt passionate about.</span></li></ol><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">This ongoing loop of observation, reflection, and action allowed Jane to continually adapt to her evolving understanding of her career satisfaction. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Could you benefit from a similar approach?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c10">Not </span><span class="c10 c17">Adaptive action, not resilient, rigid, resistant, blocked, quitting </span><span class="c17"><br></span><span class="c37 c17 c25">How to </span><span class="c37 c25">I</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">ncorporate &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; into your life.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Bringing &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; into your life can help you navigate challenges with greater clarity and confidence. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c70 c39 c17">Consider this approach to being more Adaptive:</span></p><ol class="c41 lst-kix_yrk79d4nkfsf-0 start" start="1"><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c43 c25">Journal:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Make it a daily habit to jot down your activities, thoughts, and feelings. This will help you track patterns and identify areas where adaptability is needed.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c43 c25">Reflect:</span><span class="c43">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Set aside quiet time each week to reflect on your journal entries. Consider what&rsquo;s working, what isn&rsquo;t, and where you can make changes.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c43 c25">Choose Action Steps: </span><span class="c8">Based on your reflections, list small, manageable steps you can take to adapt and improve. These steps should be practical and easy to implement.</span></li></ol><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Remember, life is constantly changing, and adopting a flexible, adaptive approach allows you to better handle the complexities and uncertainties that arise. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">By integrating Adaptive Action into your routine, you&rsquo;ll build resilience and navigate life&rsquo;s challenges with more confidence.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c33 c10 c17">Adaptive change, flexible, relationships, connection, resilient, </span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c37 c17 c25">Navigate friendships with adaptive action</span><span class="c37 c25">: A Case Study.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">Can you embrace change in personal relationships? Do you know how to do this in </span><span>an adaptive</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;and </span><span>positive</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;way?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">Friendships, like everything in life, evolve. Sometimes, you might feel a distance growing or perhaps a clash of interests. The &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo; </span><span>approach</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;can </span><span>provide</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;a </span><span>way</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;through these </span><span>difficult</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;times. Give </span><span>this</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;</span><span>a try.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider</span><span class="c39 c17">&nbsp;this </span><span class="c43">approach</span><span class="c39 c17">: </span><span class="c17 c40">Below is an example </span><span>of Sara using Adaptive</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;</span><span>Action</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;in </span><span>relationships</span><span class="c17 c40">. It utilizes the 3 steps of: &ldquo;What? So what? </span><span>and</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;</span><span>N</span><span class="c8">ow what?&rdquo;&hellip;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c25 c40">What?</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Sarah noticed she and her childhood friend, Lily, weren&rsquo;t laughing as much or sharing stories like before.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c25 c40">So what? </span><span class="c8">Reflecting on this, Sarah realized their interests had diverged. While she was into hiking and outdoor adventures, Lily was more engrossed in arts and theater.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c25 c40">Now what?</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Instead of lamenting the drift, Sarah proposed they attend a theater play outdoors, combining both their passions.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c33 c17 c265"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c10">Not </span><span class="c33 c10 c17">Adaptive action, flexible, resilient, relationships, connection</span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.31qylvbc4mye"><span>Consider </span><span class="c37 c17 c25">Adaptive Action in the kitchen</span><span>: An Example.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Ever had a recipe go awry or found yourself missing ingredients? The kitchen is a perfect place to illustrate &lsquo;Adaptive Action&rsquo;!</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider the case of </span><span class="c39 c17">Mike</span><span class="c43">:</span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;He wanted to bake cookies but found he was out of eggs.</span><span>&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Recalling a vegan recipe, he realized he could use mashed bananas as a substitute.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">He went ahead with the banana substitution, resulting in a delightful new cookie variant!</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">What&#39;s t</span><span class="c39 c17">he takeaway message? </span><span class="c17 c40">&nbsp;</span><span>It&rsquo;</span><span class="c17 c40">s don&rsquo;t fret when things don&rsquo;t go as planned. Adapt, innovate, and enjoy the delicious outcomes.</span></p><h1 class="c26 c7" id="h.dmroayaz5269"><span class="c73 c2 c25"></span></h1><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c33 c10 c17">adaptive action, rigid, reactive, resistant, stubborn ,oppositional, blocked, quitting </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.ipd34qh0y8xm"><span>Resolve</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;to Adapt using Conscious </span><span>Positive</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;Choices.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Choosing to adapt empowers you and gives you control over your reactions. But how can you put this into practice?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider this simple technique:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;When faced with change, pause, take a deep breath, or two and say to yourself, &quot;I choose to adapt.&quot;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Repeat this affirmation until you feel calmer and more centered. Then, make a thoughtful, conscious positive choice or decision.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">With time, this habit of pausing and choosing to adapt in a positive way can become your natural response to change. This can help you navigate life&rsquo;s twists and turns with greater ease and confidence.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10 c17">Blocked, rigid, resistant, stubborn, oppositional, quitting, overwhelmed </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.q1mbyy4irjx7"><span>Welcome Change&mdash;Don&rsquo;t Fear It: Shift Your Perspective.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Welcoming change can transform your perspective, turning fear into excitement. By shifting your mindset to a more positive outlook, you can start seeing change as an opportunity rather than a threat. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">The key is to focus on the benefits that a change can bring. Give this a try. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">To help reinforce this approach, try this simple exercise: </span><span class="c8">At the end of each day, write down one way you embraced change and how it benefited you. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">A daily reflection practice will help you recognize the positive aspects of change and gradually enhance your adaptability.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c10">Not </span><span class="c10 c17">Adaptive action, not </span><span class="c10">resilient, not calm, upset, breathing</span><span class="c33 c10 c17">, not mindfulness quitting</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c17">&nbsp;</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">Practice Mindful Breathing</span><span class="c37 c25">: Calm yourself before Choosing.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span>The simple practice of mindful breathing can calm your mind. This makes it easier for you to make new conscious choices and adapt to change. </span><span>Do you know how to do it?</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Find a safe, quiet and comfortable spot. Simply notice how it flows in and out naturally, without trying to change it.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your challenge:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Start by practicing mindful breathing for a few minutes each day if you are not already doing this. This can enhance your adaptability and resilience.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c43">:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Pick one part of your daily routine and switch it up. For instance, if you usually start your day with coffee, try having tea instead. They can offer valuable guidance and encouragement.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">By leaning on the strength of others, you enhance your resilience and broaden your capacity for adaptation.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID} &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10">Not </span><span class="c10 c17">adaptive Action, hero&rsquo;s journey, </span><span class="c10">facing</span><span class="c10 c17">&nbsp;the </span><span class="c10">fear</span><span class="c10 c17">, </span><span class="c10">&nbsp;freeze, </span><span class="c33 c10 c17">&nbsp;quest, personal growth, transformation </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.j2z8tu58df47"><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;Harness </span><span>the Superpower of</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;Action: </span><span>Face your</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">&nbsp;</span><span>F</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">ears.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c20 c17">In every superhero&rsquo;s journey, there comes a point where they must face their fears and embrace their true potential. Much like these fictional champions, we too possess a potent superpower. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c58 c17">If we use this power we can overcome the ominous shadows of fear that lurk within our minds. English psychologist and author Julie Smith wisely points out</span><span class="c58">&nbsp;that</span><span class="c20 c17">:</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c33 c17 c32">&nbsp;&ldquo;In the fight against fear, action is your superpower.&rdquo;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c20 c17">Understand that fear can seem like a formidable foe: It cripples our ability to think clearly, paralyzes our ambition, and chains us to a life of complacency. Yet, within each of us lies the innate ability to break free from these chains through action. This happens through action. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c58">W</span><span class="c20 c17">hen we act, despite the fear, we rob it of its power over us. Each step forward weakens the hold fear has on our lives, enabling us to achieve our goals and realize our full potential.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c58 c17 c43">Your Challenge:</span><span class="c58 c17">&nbsp;Identify one small fear that has been holding you back. Break down the action required into small, manageable parts, and tackle your fear one </span><span class="c58">small act </span><span class="c20 c17">at a time. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c33 c2"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c115">&nbsp; &nbsp; </span><span class="c123">HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10 c17">Adaptive action, not flexible, personal growth, </span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.a5f2djkr0nnh"><span class="c37 c17 c25">Embrace Adaptability: The pathway to personal growth.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c8">In the ever-changing landscape of life, adaptive action is a crucial skill, a companion that helps us navigate the various seasons of our existence. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c17 c40">C.S. Lewis&#39;s insightful words offers a fresh perspective:</span><span class="c33 c111 c17">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c111 c17">&quot;There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.&quot;</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Viewing change as an opportunity for personal growth and self-discovery allows us to approach life&rsquo;s transitions with optimism and excitement. It enables us to evolve, learn, and expand our horizons, enriching our lives in countless ways.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c43">Your Challenge</span><span class="c39 c17">:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Identify one area of your life where change is beckoning. Approach it with openness and a growth mindset, fueled by the belief in better things ahead. Allow this change to be a catalyst for your personal growth. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c14"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID} &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c33 c10 c17">Adaptive action, magical thinking, lacking effort,</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><h1 class="c26" id="h.gyt3up9dvr3p"><span>Try an Action Board: The Power Beyond Vision Boards.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c20 c17">Vision boards are popular for visualizing your dreams and aspirations, but an Action Board takes it a step further by focusing on the concrete steps needed to turn those dreams into reality. While a vision board is about seeing your end goals, an action board breaks down the process into actionable tasks, making the journey clear and manageable.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c156 c58 c17 c43 c25">Five Key Differences of an Action Board Vs Vision Board:</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><ol class="c41 lst-kix_w6ed9ul57lkj-0 start" start="1"><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c58 c43">Action-Focused:</span><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;An Action Board is centered around the specific steps required to achieve your goals. It&rsquo;s not just about dreaming big but about identifying and committing to the actions that will get you there.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c58 c43">Practical Planning:</span><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;Unlike a vision board that might feature images of a dream vacation or an ideal career, an action board will include tasks like setting up a savings plan, updating your resume, or attending networking events. It&rsquo;s about creating a practical, step-by-step plan to turn your vision into reality.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c58 c43">Progress Tracking:</span><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;One of the most motivating aspects of an action board is its ability to track your progress visually. As you complete each task, you can mark it off, giving you a tangible sense of achievement that propels you forward.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c58 c43">Adaptability:</span><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;Life is unpredictable, and sometimes plans need to change. The action board&rsquo;s focus on processes rather than just outcomes makes it adaptable. If a strategy isn&rsquo;t working, you can easily adjust your steps while still keeping your ultimate goal in sight.</span></li><li class="c1 c79 c24 li-bullet-0"><span class="c58 c43">Accountability:</span><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;An action board serves as a daily reminder of what needs to be done, helping you stay on track and hold yourself accountable. It encourages consistent, proactive effort toward achieving your goals.</span></li></ol><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c20 c17">Whether you create one digitally or on a traditional board, an action board can be a powerful tool in propelling you toward your goals. The next time you&rsquo;re planning your future, consider creating an action board to transform your aspirations into achievable actions and bring your dreams to life.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c151 c45 c61 c7 title" id="h.60s8u7f3o0ev"><span class="c73 c10 c47 c25"></span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c115 c124">{M:DEFINE}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp; </span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c33 c10 c17">Assertive, </span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c37 c17 c25">What does being &lsquo;</span><span class="c37 c25">A</span><span class="c37 c17 c25">ssertive&rsquo; mean? &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Being &lsquo;assertive&rsquo; means confidently expressing your thoughts, feelings, and needs while respecting others. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Imagine you&#39;re at a restaurant, and your meal isn&#39;t quite right. Instead of staying quiet or getting angry, being assertive would mean politely letting the server know about the issue and asking for it to be fixed. It&#39;s about standing up for yourself without stepping on anyone else&#39;s toes. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c8">Assertiveness is a healthy balance&mdash;neither too passive nor too aggressive&mdash;allowing you to communicate clearly and build positive, respectful relationships. It&rsquo;s the key to feeling heard and valued in any situation.</span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c72">{M:EARLY}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp; </span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c59 c36">Not</span><span class="c59 c36 c17">&nbsp;assertive, assertive, passive aggressive, angry, appeasing, passive, avoidant, acquiescence, timid, kowtowing, yesman,</span></p><h1 class="c34 c45 c61" id="h.ho8w1rco6ei8"><span class="c12">Speak Up for Yourself: Master Assertiveness.</span></h1><p class="c34 c45"><span class="c8">Assertiveness is an essential skill for healthy relationships and personal growth. It&#39;s standing up for yourself while respecting others.</span></p><p class="c34 c45"><span class="c8">Being assertive means expressing your needs, desires, and feelings openly and honestly. You don&rsquo;t expect others to read your mind; instead, you calmly and clearly ask for what you want. Remember, while you have the right to make requests, others have the right to say no.</span></p><p class="c34 c45"><span>Understand that Assertiveness isn&#39;t about winning or dominating conversations. It&#39;s about creating an environment of mutual respect where everyone&#39;s voice is heard. By practicing assertiveness, you can build stronger, more positive relationships and ensure that your needs are met without stepping on anyone else&#39;s toes.</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7 c81"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c72">{M:EARLY}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp; </span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10">Not </span><span class="c10 c17">Assertiveness, controlled , people pleasing ,</span><span class="c10">&nbsp;manipulated easily </span><span class="c10 c17">acquiescence, kowtowing , fawn, kowtowing, yes man &nbsp;yak like , yoked, yielding assured, communicating, negotiating, self confident &nbsp;</span></p><h1 class="c38" id="h.7mgnkw3jae24"><span>Discover 7 Benefits of Being Assertive.</span></h1><p class="c1"><span class="c20 c17">Assertiveness is about standing up for yourself while respecting others. It&rsquo;s finding the balance between being silent and being too pushy. </span></p><p class="c1 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c156 c58 c17 c43 c25">Seven reasons why </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c156 c39 c17 c25">Embracing Assertiveness can help your life as follows:</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c156 c39 c17 c25"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43 c25">Speaking Up with Confidence:</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Assertiveness empowers you to class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">By practicing assertiveness, you build self-esteem and autonomy, enabling you to make confident decisions and fully embrace your worth.</span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43 c25">Promoting Fairness:</span><span class="c43">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Assertiveness helps you ensure fairness in your interactions, fostering balanced and class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">In summary, by cultivating assertiveness, you&rsquo;ll boost your confidence, strengthen your relationships, and create a more fulfilling life. These instinctual behaviors can offer valuable insights into assertiveness.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider</span><span class="c43">&nbsp;this approach: </span><span class="c8">Spend time watching animals in action, whether at a park or online. Observe how they establish boundaries and assert their needs.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">&nbsp;Reflect on these instinctual behaviors and think about how you can apply similar techniques to your own life. By learning from animals, you can enhance your assertiveness and better protect your personal boundaries.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c10 c30">&nbsp;Not assertive, not boundaries, manipulated easily, controlled easily, hypnotized, zombie </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.j3mmqvdjqo49"><span class="c12">Assertiveness Building: Set Boundaries with Confidence.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Developing assertiveness is key to resisting manipulation and setting clear boundaries in your life. Resolve to become more assertive. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider</span><span class="c43">&nbsp;this approach:</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Begin by practicing assertiveness in low-stakes situations, and gradually move on to more challenging ones. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Use &quot;I&quot; statements to express your thoughts and feelings clearly, and practice active listening to understand others while maintaining your boundaries. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Reflect on each experience and celebrate your progress as you grow in assertiveness and confidence.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c97 c56 c134 c45 c79 c36"><span class="c164 c10 c120">&nbsp;not assertive, not boundaries, appeasing, kowtowing, yesman, &nbsp;Not self confident, Easily manipulated, &nbsp;controlled, </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.22he7pc3i1be"><span class="c12">Assertiveness Practice: Practice setting Limits.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Your challenge:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Identify a situation where you often struggle to set boundaries or say no. Practice setting your limits and enforcing them. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach: </span><span class="c8">Prepare a script to help you communicate your limits or decline requests firmly yet respectfully. Consider role-playing the scenario with a trusted friend or in front of a mirror, using your prepared script. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Focus on maintaining a confident and assertive tone. Reflect on the experience and note any improvements in your ability to set boundaries effectively.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c97 c56 c134 c45 c79 c36"><span class="c10 c120 c164">&nbsp;not assertive, manipulated easily, &nbsp;controlled, &nbsp;no boundaries, appeasing, kowtowing, yesman, &nbsp;Not self confident, </span></p><h1 class="c96 c45 c61" id="h.cnvauko5niuz"><span>Build Assertiveness: </span><span>Align Your Actions with Core Values.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">To start being more assertive you could start by identifying and clarifying your core values. This will help you identify what really matters to you. It&#39;s easier to stand up for what you really believe in. &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Think about what matters most to you in areas like relationships, career, and personal growth. Then, reflect on how well your current actions align with these values. Doing this will strengthen your sense of integrity and reduce your vulnerability to outside influences.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Your challenge</span><span class="c43">:</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c8">Choose one area of your life where your actions don&rsquo;t fully match your values. Identify one small step you can take to bring your behavior closer to what truly matters to you.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Implement this change and notice how it strengthens your sense of integrity and assertiveness</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c97 c56 c45 c79 c36 c134"><span class="c164 c10 c120">Not assertiveness, manipulated easily , &nbsp;controlled, &nbsp;no boundaries, appeasing, kowtowing, yesman, &nbsp;Not self confident, </span></p><h1 class="c96 c45 c61" id="h.j704niam2rxy"><span class="c12">Strengthen your Assertiveness: Start Small &amp; Build.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Developing assertiveness takes practice, especially in situations where you tend to struggle. If you want know more about chakras and the throat chakra then read on: </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c20 c17">&nbsp;Chakras are believed to be energy centers within the body that influence various aspects of our physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being. There are seven main chakras, each associated with a specific area of the body and different aspects of life.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c20 c17">The Throat Chakra, known as Vishuddha in Sanskrit, is located in the throat area and is responsible for communication, self-expression, and truth. When this chakra is balanced, you can express yourself clearly and authentically. However, if it&rsquo;s blocked or imbalanced, you might find it difficult to speak up, or you might struggle to express your true thoughts and feelings.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c20 c17">By bringing your Throat Chakra into balance, you&rsquo;ll find it easier to speak your truth and communicate effectively, which can enhance your relationships and deepen your sense of personal integrity.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c20 c17"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c33 c10 c17">Not assertive, not boundaries, controlled easily, manipulated easily, kowtowing, acquiescence, yes man, &nbsp; </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.uqqbrmmylj4g"><span class="c12">Choose &amp; Defend Your Boundaries: Stand up for yourself. </span></h1><p class="c1"><span>James R. This simple technique can help calm your mind, center your thoughts, ground yourself and tap into your inner strength. This enhances your ability to communicate confidently.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c43">Consider this technique: </span><span class="c8">Find a safe, quiet space and sit comfortably. Close your eyes, inhale deeply through your nose, allowing your abdomen to expand. Hold for a few seconds, then exhale slowly through your mouth. Focus mindfully on each breath, grounding yourself in the present moment. Practice this daily till it feels natural and automatic. &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c8">This style of focused breathing can reduce anxiety and stress, helping you approach conversations with clarity and composure. This approach helps you gain clarity, build confidence, and refine your communication skills.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Identify a situation where you struggle with passivity and write a script for handling it assertively. Focus on clear language, expressing your needs, and maintaining a respectful tone.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c8">Rehearse the words out loud, visualizing the scenario and embodying assertiveness. Pay attention to your tone, body language, and mindset. Repeat this until you feel confident.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c8">Scripted conversations provide a safe space to practice and build your assertiveness, empowering you to handle real-life situations with confidence and grace.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7 c81"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, no boundaries, passive, timid</span></p><h1 class="c104 c61" id="h.s5i6xn8a3pqm"><span>Boost Assertiveness: Use</span><span class="c12">&nbsp;the Power of Daily Affirmations.</span></h1><p class="c29"><span>You can further b</span><span class="c8">oost your assertiveness by incorporating daily affirmations into your routine. Affirmations are positive statements that reinforce your self-worth and confidence in expressing your needs.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Start each day by standing in front of a mirror and reciting affirmations like, &quot;I am worthy of expressing my needs&quot; or &quot;I communicate assertively and with confidence.&quot; Repeating these affirmations throughout the day helps solidify an assertive mindset.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c8">By making affirmations a daily habit, you cultivate a positive self-perception and build the foundation for assertive communication. </span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c8">Remember, assertiveness starts from within. Embrace affirmations and watch them transform your confidence and empower your voice.</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c27">not boundaries,</span><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, passive, timid, no confidence, no courage, </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.wa306e1265xi"><span class="c12">Embrace Your Voice: Employ the Power of Assertiveness.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Do you find it hard to say no or express your true feelings? Assertiveness is the key to unlocking your inner strength and building healthier relationships. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Start your quest for more assertiveness by recognizing that your needs and opinions are just as important as others. Practice expressing your thoughts calmly and clearly without apologizing or feeling guilty. Use &quot;I&quot; statements, such as &quot;I feel&quot; or &quot;I need,&quot; to take ownership of your feelings and avoid blaming others. Give this a try. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Remember, being assertive isn&#39;t about being aggressive; it&#39;s about standing up for yourself with respect and confidence. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Take small steps each day to assert your boundaries, and soon you&#39;ll notice a positive change in your interactions and self-esteem.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c10">&nbsp;Disempowered, </span><span class="c27">not boundaries,</span><span class="c10">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, passive, timid</span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.ick8kqg6a5lo"><span class="c12">Set Boundaries: Your Path to Empowerment.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Setting boundaries is essential for maintaining your emotional well-being and fostering respect in relationships. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Begin by identifying areas in your life where you feel overwhelmed or taken advantage of. Clearly define your limits and communicate them assertively to others. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Use phrases like &quot;I can&#39;t commit to that right now&quot; or &quot;I need some time for myself.&quot; It&#39;s important to stay firm and consistent with your boundaries, even if it feels uncomfortable at first. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Remember, you have the right to prioritize your needs without feeling guilty. As you practice setting and maintaining boundaries, you&#39;ll find yourself feeling more empowered, respected, and in control of your life.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;HIGH</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Appeasing, yes man, Not assertive, not boundaries, passive, timid, </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.bz2ckvcfed3v"><span class="c12">Learn the Art of Saying &lsquo;No&rsquo;: A Step Towards Assertiveness.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Do you struggle with saying &lsquo;no&rsquo;, fearing it might disappoint others? Learning to say &lsquo;no&rsquo; is a crucial part of being assertive. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this simple approach: </span><span class="c8">Start by acknowledging your right to say &lsquo;no&rsquo; without feeling guilty. Practice with simple situations, like declining a social invitation when you need rest. Use clear and polite language, such as &quot;I&#39;m sorry, but I can&#39;t make it this time.&quot; </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Remember, saying &lsquo;no&rsquo; allows you to prioritize your needs and avoid overcommitment. As you become more comfortable with this skill, you&#39;ll gain confidence and respect from others. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Recommend Reading: </span><span class="c43">When I Say No, I Feel Guilty </span><span class="c8">by Manuel J. Smith. This book offers practical tips on assertiveness.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; HIGH </span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c27">Not assertive, not boundaries, passive, timid, lacking self worth</span><span class="c84">&nbsp; </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.6v25tgqvfjy0"><span class="c12">Cultivate Self-Worth: The Foundation of Assertiveness.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Recognize that a &nbsp;strong sense of self-worth is essential for assertiveness. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this simple approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Begin by recognizing and valuing your strengths and achievements. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Replace negative self-talk with a positive mindset and consider using affirmations, like &quot;I am worthy of respect.&quot; </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Surround yourself with supportive people who encourage your growth. Also practice self-care regularly to reinforce your worthiness. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">As your self-esteem grows, so will your ability to assert your needs and boundaries confidently. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Recommend Reading: Bren&eacute; Brown, </span><span class="c43">The Gifts of Imperfection </span><span class="c8">by Bren&eacute; Brown. &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, not boundaries, passive, timid, not self confidence, not assured &nbsp;</span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.56s0x4swnttk"><span class="c12">Communicate with Confidence: Watch your body language.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Your body language plays a crucial role in how assertive you appear to others. Aim to observe and improve your body language.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Stand tall with your shoulders back and maintain eye contact during conversations. Use open gestures, like uncrossed arms, to show you&#39;re approachable and confident.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">&nbsp;Speak in a clear, steady voice, avoiding hesitant phrases like &quot;I think&quot; or &quot;I&#39;m not sure.&quot; </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Remember, practicing positive body language can enhance your assertiveness and ensure your message is taken seriously. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Recommended</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span>Reading: </span><span class="c43">The Assertiveness Workbook </span><span class="c8">by Randy J. Paterson. This book provides &nbsp;exercises to improve both your verbal and non-verbal communication skills.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, approval seeking, appeasing, yesman, &nbsp;no boundaries, passive, timid, not confident, </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.nenvox6u36vc"><span class="c12">Overcome People-Pleasing: Step Into Your Authentic Self.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Are you constantly putting others&#39; needs before your own? Overcoming people-pleasing habits is vital for assertiveness. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach: </span><span class="c8">Start by identifying situations where you feel pressured to conform or say yes. Then practice asserting your preferences in low-stakes scenarios to build confidence.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Remind yourself that it&#39;s okay to disappoint others if it means staying true to yourself. Embrace your right to prioritize your happiness and well-being.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Recommended Reading:</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c43">The Disease to Please </span><span class="c8">by Harriet B. Braiker. This book offers strategies to break free from people-pleasing and develop a healthier self-image.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, no boundaries, passive, timid, not communication, not respectful, overwhelmed &nbsp;</span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.fegv7fp9ax1z"><span class="c12">Express Your Needs Clearly: Use Assertive Communication.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Effective communication is the cornerstone of assertiveness. </span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Practice expressing your needs and feelings clearly and directly.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp; Use &quot;I&quot; statements to own your emotions and avoid sounding accusatory. For example, say &quot;I feel overwhelmed when tasks are last-minute&quot; instead of &quot;You always give tasks last-minute.&quot; Aim to maintain a calm tone and steady pace. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">This approach fosters understanding and respect. Remember, it&#39;s not just what you say, but how you say it.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Resource: </span><span class="c43">Your Perfect Right </span><span class="c8">by Robert Alberti and Michael L. Emmons. This book provides a comprehensive guide to assertive communication techniques.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c2">{M:MID}</span><span class="c5">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">not self confident, Not assertive, no confidence, no courage, no boundaries, passive, timid, </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.g3n4h8ion22c"><span class="c12">Build Confidence: The Key to Assertiveness.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Confidence is essential for assertiveness. But how does one start? </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Consider this approach:</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;Start by setting small, achievable goals to build your self-esteem. Celebrate your successes, no matter how minor they seem. Engage in activities that make you feel competent and valued. Surround yourself with positive influences who support your growth. Practice positive self-talk to counteract doubts and fears. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">As your confidence grows, you&#39;ll find it easier to assert yourself in various situations. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span>Recommended reading:</span><span class="c25">&nbsp;</span><span class="c43">The Gifts of Imperfection</span><span class="c8">&nbsp;by Bren&eacute; Brown. This book explains more about embracing vulnerability and building self-worth.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c1"><span class="c19">==== ------ ++++++ &nbsp; this is the delimiter at the end of the blog post ++++++ ------ ====</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c64">{M:LATE}</span><span class="c21">&nbsp;</span><span class="c5">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="c29"><span class="c84">&nbsp;</span><span class="c27">Not assertive, not mindfulness, &nbsp;not boundaries, passive, timid, overwhelmed </span></p><h1 class="c104 c45 c61" id="h.5d2kk5qxbyct"><span class="c12">Use Mindfulness to Stay Present &amp; Strong.</span></h1><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Mindfulness can enhance your assertiveness by keeping you grounded and focused. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">Practice being present in your interactions, paying attention to your thoughts and feelings without judgment. This awareness helps you respond assertively rather than react impulsively.</span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c8">When you feel overwhelmed, take a deep breath and center yourself before speaking. Mindfulness also helps you recognize and respect your own needs and boundaries. </span></p><p class="c56 c45 c7"><span class="c8"></span></p><p class="c56 c45"><span class="c43">Recommend Reading:</span><span>&nbsp;</span><span class="c43">Radical Acceptance </span><span class="c8">by Tara Brach.
